name: 1.1 - If the work is under a consent, has the pre-commencement meeting with the relative council been completed and approval to start works issued?
1.2 - Has the site Geotech report been reviewed to identify soil types and ground water level?
1.3 - Has the trenching and installation methodology been confirmed to cater for the ground conditions?
1.4 - Is the SSSP been witnessed by the client
1.5 - Has the JSEA been completed and witnessed?
1.6 - Have the IFC drawings been issued
1.7 - Send all IFC drawings and design files to the surveyor for site set-out requirements
2.1 - Site is set-up and work area is fenced off before excavations start
2.2 - Check service plans for any underground assets that may come in contact with trenching operations and all plans are on site.
2.3 - Are there any services within your excavation area?
2.4 - If 'Yes' to the above; have the services been marked out and located?
2.5 - If there is a high-value or high-risk service (Power/Gas/Stategic Fibre), has the asset been located by hand digging or hydrovac excavation?
2.6 - Have all required materials been delivered to site and inspected for damage prior to installation?
2.8 - Have all persons involved in the work been inducted onto the site?
2.9 - Has the JSEA been signed by all persons involved in the works?
2.10 - Has all plant and machinery been established to site?
2.11 - Have all pre-start checks been completed on the plant and machinery being used for the job?
3.1 - Excavation completed to line and level as per survey set-out
3.2 - Ground conditions checked and subgrade tested to ensure competent substrate before laying. Soft sports to be raised with PM for further instruction.
3.3 - If required, complete undercut as per engineers' instruction and take photos.
3.4 - Place and compact granular foundation as per drawings
4.1 - Install MH structure to the line and level as indicated by the design making allowances for benching thickness and internal inverts.
4.2 - Make pipe connections to manhole to line and invert level detailed on the approved drawings and record as-built invert levels.
Comments - Attach Photos and record invert levels
4.4 - Complete concrete corbel connections to outside of MH on all main connections
4.5 - Form concrete benching inside manhole and ensure that benching is not flatter than 1 in 3 and haunching of intersecting pipes provide curved channel to ensure streamlined flow.
4.6 - Install stainless steel manhole safety steps and epoxy the back of the bolts and around the base of the step penetrations.
4.7 - Install MH riser rigns, additional steps, mahole sealing strip and seal each riser with epoxy on both sides of the manhole riser joint.
4.8 - Leak test manhole and confirm that the structure of the manhole is not leaking.
Comments - Attach Photos, Record leak test results and attach
4.9 - Backfill manhole excavation and compact in layers and test
4.10 - Install concrete manhole lid and casting
4.11 - Once pavement layers have been placed to height, raise steel castings and throats to height and check throat depth is no more than 350mm.
4.12 - Once pavement has been constructed and all vibratory activities completed; complete all sealing work around manhole lid with expoxy
4.13 - Complete all internal plastering work and expoxy sealing on the benching, pipe penetrations and riser rings to ensure that the manhole is leak proof.
4.14 - Install bungs on all pipe inlets and outlets and perform preliminary leak test on manhole.
Comments - Attach Photos, Record leak test results and attach
4.15 - Complete leak test under witness from a council inspection engineer.
Comments - Attach Photos, Record leak test results and attach
4.16 - Paint steel casting 'white' as per TCC requirements
4.17 - Complete final visual inspection with Engineer & Council Inspector
4.18 - Complete as-builts and submit to engineer
4.19 - If connecting to existing line; complete council connection application form and have the responsible drainlayer sign the form
Comments - Submit completed form to the engineer
